name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 11, Beijing. Peking University professor Dai Jinhua said at the film "Another Day Full of Hope" theme talk: I was shocked to see the ratio of masters to bachelors among Beijing express delivery workers. The ratio of masters was once 7%, and the ratio of undergraduate graduates exceeded 13%.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, financier Li Lu’s latest statement was circulated online, in which he mentioned: without a modern market economy, modern technology would not emerge; fair institutional control is more sustainable than human control; the essence of a market economy is the government handing over economic power to the private sector; without personal safety guarantees, people’s pursuit of wealth will be greatly reduced.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 17, Wuchuan City, Guangdong. Dinglong Bay tourist attraction owed workers wages, and workers held up banners at the site to demand their wages.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the evening of September 16, in Loudi, Hunan, the owners of the Country Garden Haoyuan Xia community reported that the funeral hall operated near the community often played funeral music and fireworks, which disturbed the owners' rest. That night, the owners went to negotiate and a physical conflict broke out between the two sides.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 16, Hohhot, Inner Mongolia. The future owners of Jindi Fengqi reported that the power company wanted to build a substation near the community, which caused the owners to be dissatisfied and put up banners at the sales office to defend their rights.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 12, migrant workers at Qingzhou Foreign Language School in Shandong Province held up banners to demand their wages, during which their banners and mobile phones used for taking photos were snatched away.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 17, Datong, Shanxi. A food company in Guangling County owed wages to workers picking peppers. The workers covered their faces and cried in front of the police. "They don't pay us, and they don't let us go home."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 13, Heilongjiang. The Boyue Hot Spring Hotel owed workers wages, and workers held up banners to demand their wages.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 17 (Released), in Nanning, Guangxi, migrant workers in the Hanlin community of Longguang Junyu Huafu demanded their wages.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 17, workers demanded their wages at the gate of the new campus of Luoyang No. 8 Senior High School.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 15, Sichuan. Owners of the Yanlanzhou Xiangmanli community reported that the property management company forcibly occupied the community hall and rented it out, causing dissatisfied owners to hold up banners to defend their rights.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 15, Zhengzhou, Henan. The Zhengshang Shuxiu Huafu project has been completed long ago, but the workers' wages are still in arrears. The workers put up banners at the sales office to demand their wages.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 15, Changde, Hunan. Deposits at the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China in Li County were converted into insurance, and depositors held banners outside the bank to protest their rights.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 17, Henan migrant worker Fang Junling reported Xingyang Court judge Wang Hao under his real name, accusing him of illegally unblocking three accounts under the name of Sigma Company, the company that had withheld wages from migrant workers, which contained more than 22 million yuan in deposits.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 16, the Central News Agency quoted the Sing Tao Daily as reporting that a "political earthquake" had recently occurred at the Institute of Economics of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences. The entire leadership was replaced for allegedly "making irresponsible comments about the central government." This was another political incident at the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences after the "spy case" more than a decade ago.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 16, Jining, Shandong. A boy beat his mother several times at the gate of the community after failing to extort money. Many people stepped forward to stop him, and the boy was finally taken away by the police.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: According to a report on September 15, the General Office of the State Council issued an opinion: Develop food resources in an all-round and multi-channel manner to expand food sources.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 16, Wuxi, Jiangsu. Typhoon Bebejia passed through Jiangsu. On that day, a takeaway boy was hit by a fallen shelf and fell to the ground.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 17 (Released) A foreign teacher on the Lingostar one-to-one tutoring platform told a student that Taiwan is an independent country and can never be China. The parent next to him reminded the foreign teacher that Taiwan belongs to China, and the two sides had a dispute. The foreign teacher then said, "Taiwan is Taiwan, screw China," and then the two sides ended the call.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 17, Shenzhen, Guangdong. A commendation notice from a hardware products company in Shenzhen was circulated online. The notice stated that four employees of the company started work more than ten minutes early. The company advocated this kind of professionalism and gave each of the four employees a reward of 30 yuan.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 16, Guangdong. It was reported online that Gu Ming Milk Tea Shop made employees wear paper handcuffs with guilt signs. Some netizens said, "What's the difference between this and the Cultural Revolution struggle sessions?"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Song Binbin, a second-generation Red Guard leader, died on September 16 at the age of 77. She immigrated to the United States in 1980 under the pretext of studying abroad and returned to China in 2003. In 2014, she apologized to the teachers and classmates who were harmed during the Cultural Revolution. However, Bian Zhongyun's husband Wang Jingyao issued a statement, calling Song Binbin and Liu Jin's apologies hypocritical and saying that he would not accept their apologies until the truth was revealed.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 17 (Released) Shuozhou, Shanxi. It was reported online that a freshman at Huairen Yundong Middle School was punished for a serious violation of discipline because he went to the toilet after 11pm. The student wrote in the letter of guarantee that "going to the toilet at night is a selfish act that affects the sleep of others."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: September 16 (Release) A female translator posted a video saying that Yu Fengqiao, Director of the External Relations Department and International Trade Department of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization Economic and Trade Exchange Center, owed her 20,000 yuan in translation fees. Because Minister Yu was a project participant, the translation work was basically for him to communicate with foreign guests, but Minister Yu was firm: I didn't hire you, I'll find whoever I need to find. The female translator said helplessly: You are negotiating a multi-billion oil trade, and you are even owing 20,000 yuan?
